concepts.title: Generative AI
concepts.l0: A knowledge graph of generative AI concepts, methods, systems, risks, and practices.
l1: Prefer a small, consistent edge vocabulary
Attach sources to nodes and evidence chunks to edges

concepts.title: Foundations & Theory
concepts.l0: Core generative modeling paradigms, representations, scaling, and reliability concerns.

concepts.title: Model Families & Architectures
concepts.l0: Transformer and post-transformer model families and architectural variants.

concepts.title: Training, Post-training & Alignment
concepts.l0: Pretraining, fine-tuning, preference optimization, and safety training.

concepts.title: Retrieval, Knowledge Integration & Memory
concepts.l0: RAG, knowledge graphs, graph retrieval, and application memory architectures.

concepts.title: Agents, Tool Use & Protocols
concepts.l0: Agent architectures, tool-use primitives, and interoperability protocols.

concepts.title: Evaluation, Observability & LLMOps
concepts.l0: Evals, tracing, monitoring, prompt/model registries, and operational practice.

concepts.title: Inference, Serving, Hardware & Systems
concepts.l0: Inference optimization, serving systems, attention kernels, and hardware constraints.

concepts.title: Security, Safety & Red Teaming
concepts.l0: Threats and mitigations for LLM applications, including prompt injection and tool abuse.

concepts.title: Responsible AI, Governance & Compliance
concepts.l0: Risk frameworks, regulations, and governance artifacts for AI systems.

concepts.title: AI UX/UI & Product Patterns
concepts.l0: Human-AI interaction patterns and product design practices for GenAI features.

concepts.title: Adaptive Systems & Data Flywheels
concepts.l0: Instrumentation-to-improvement loops, personalization mechanisms, and flywheel failure modes.

concepts.title: Generative Modeling Paradigms
concepts.l0: Core paradigms for how generative models produce outputs.

concepts.title: Autoregressive Generation
concepts.l0: Next-token (or next-patch) prediction; the dominant paradigm for LLMs.
l1: Scales well with compute and data

concepts.title: Diffusion / Denoising Processes
concepts.l0: Generate data by iteratively denoising from noise; works for continuous and discrete tokens.
l1: Discrete diffusion for text is frontier research

concepts.title: Flow-based / Rectified Flows
concepts.l0: Invertible transformations between data and latent space; flow-matching is frontier for multimodal.

concepts.title: Energy-based Models
concepts.l0: Define unnormalized probability via energy function; appears in reranking and reward modeling.

concepts.title: Representation & Tokenization
concepts.l0: How inputs are converted to model-consumable representations.

concepts.title: Tokenization
concepts.l0: Splitting text (or other modalities) into subword/patch tokens for model input.

concepts.title: Embeddings
concepts.l0: Dense vector representations of tokens, positions, segments, and modalities.

concepts.title: Latent Spaces
concepts.l0: Learned continuous spaces for text, images, or cross-modal alignment.

concepts.title: Generalization & Scaling
concepts.l0: How model capability scales with compute, data, and parameters.

concepts.title: Scaling Laws
concepts.l0: Predictable relationships between compute, data size, model size, and loss.

concepts.title: Data Quality > Quantity
concepts.l0: Filtering, deduplication, and mixture design often matter more than raw data volume.

concepts.title: Test-time Compute Scaling
concepts.l0: Spending more inference compute (search, retry, chain-of-thought) to improve reasoning quality.
l1: Frontier efficiency: compute-optimal allocation per prompt

concepts.title: Uncertainty & Calibration
concepts.l0: Quantifying and communicating model confidence.

concepts.title: Confidence Estimation
concepts.l0: Methods to estimate how confident a model is in its outputs.

concepts.title: Selective Prediction / Abstention
concepts.l0: Choosing not to answer when the model is insufficiently confident.

concepts.title: Calibration
concepts.l0: Ensuring predicted probabilities match actual correctness rates.

concepts.title: Key Problem Families
concepts.l0: Fundamental challenge areas that cut across all GenAI work.

concepts.title: Reasoning (Math, Logic, Planning)
concepts.l0: Multi-step logical inference, mathematical problem-solving, and planning.

concepts.title: Factuality / Grounding / Citations
concepts.l0: Ensuring model outputs are grounded in verifiable facts with proper attribution.

concepts.title: Safety / Harmlessness / Policy Compliance
concepts.l0: Preventing harmful, biased, or policy-violating outputs.

concepts.title: Robustness (OOD, Adversarial)
concepts.l0: Maintaining quality under distribution shift and adversarial inputs.

concepts.title: Personalization vs Privacy
concepts.l0: Balancing user-specific adaptation with data protection and consent.

concepts.title: Transformer Family
concepts.l0: The dominant architecture family for LLMs and many multimodal models.
l1: Attention mechanism is the core computational primitive

concepts.title: Decoder-only Transformer
concepts.l0: Autoregressive transformer used by most modern LLMs (GPT, LLaMA, etc.).

concepts.title: Encoder-Decoder Transformer
concepts.l0: Seq2seq transformer for translation, summarization (T5, BART).

concepts.title: Encoder-only Transformer
concepts.l0: Bidirectional transformer for embeddings, retrieval, classification (BERT).

concepts.title: Attention Mechanisms
concepts.l0: Core computational primitive of transformers; mixes information across tokens.

concepts.title: Self-attention
concepts.l0: A mechanism that mixes information across tokens using query-key matching.

concepts.title: Multi-Head Attention (MHA)
concepts.l0: Standard attention with multiple independent heads for diverse feature capture.

concepts.title: Multi-Query / Grouped-Query Attention
concepts.l0: Share K/V heads across query heads to reduce KV cache size and improve throughput.
l1: GQA: grouped K/V heads (balance between MHA and MQA)

concepts.title: Block-sparse Attention
concepts.l0: Attend to blocks of tokens instead of all tokens; frontier for very long context.

concepts.title: Sparse / Linear Attention
concepts.l0: Approximate attention with subquadratic complexity; various tradeoffs with quality.

concepts.title: Positional Encoding & Long-context
concepts.l0: Methods to inject position information and support long sequences.

concepts.title: RoPE (Rotary Position Embedding)
concepts.l0: Rotary embeddings that encode relative position via rotation matrices; widely used in modern LLMs.
l1: RoPE scaling families extend context length

concepts.title: ALiBi
concepts.l0: Attention with Linear Biases; adds linear position penalty to attention scores.

concepts.title: Sliding-window Attention
concepts.l0: Each token attends only to a fixed window of nearby tokens; used in Mistral and others.

concepts.title: Memory-augmented Attention
concepts.l0: Recurrence or segment-level memory to extend effective context beyond the window.

concepts.title: Normalization & Residual Design
concepts.l0: Layer normalization variants and residual connection patterns.

concepts.title: Pre-norm vs Post-norm
concepts.l0: Pre-norm (normalize before attention/FFN) is standard in modern LLMs; post-norm was original.

concepts.title: RMSNorm / LayerNorm Variants
concepts.l0: RMSNorm removes mean centering for efficiency; widely adopted in modern architectures.

concepts.title: Output Heads
concepts.l0: How the transformer produces final predictions.

concepts.title: Standard LM Head
concepts.l0: Linear projection to vocabulary logits for next-token prediction.

concepts.title: Multi-token Prediction Heads
concepts.l0: Predict multiple future tokens simultaneously; frontier research for faster generation.

concepts.title: Structured Generation (Constrained Decoding)
concepts.l0: Constrain decoding to valid JSON, SQL, or other schemas via grammar-guided sampling.

concepts.title: Mixture-of-Experts (MoE)
concepts.l0: Sparse architecture where only a subset of expert networks activate per token.

concepts.title: Switch Transformer
concepts.l0: Simplified MoE with one expert per token; demonstrated efficient MoE scaling.

concepts.title: Routing Robustness & Security
concepts.l0: Router manipulation attacks and stability concerns in MoE models.

concepts.title: MoE + Quantization / Distillation
concepts.l0: Combining MoE sparsity with quantization or distillation for efficiency.

concepts.title: Heterogeneous Experts
concepts.l0: Specialized experts for different domains or tools rather than identical architectures.

concepts.title: MoE for Multimodal
concepts.l0: Applying MoE to handle different modalities with specialized expert pathways.

concepts.title: State Space Models (SSMs)
concepts.l0: Sequence models based on state space formulations; compete with attention for long sequences.

concepts.title: Structured SSMs (S4)
concepts.l0: Structured state space model that handles very long sequences efficiently.

concepts.title: Mamba (Selective SSM)
concepts.l0: Selective state space model; a serious competitor for long-sequence tasks.

concepts.title: Mamba-2 / State Space Duality
concepts.l0: Unifies transformers and SSMs via state space duality framing with speedups.

concepts.title: MoE-Mamba
concepts.l0: Combines Mixture-of-Experts sparsity with SSM sequence modeling.

concepts.title: Multimodal SSM Variants
concepts.l0: Applying SSM architectures to multimodal inputs; active research direction.

concepts.title: Diffusion Language Models
concepts.l0: Text generation via discrete diffusion processes rather than autoregressive decoding.

concepts.title: Discrete Diffusion for Language
concepts.l0: Diffusion trained from scratch for text under pretrain + SFT paradigm (e.g., LLaDA direction).

concepts.title: Parallel Decoding vs AR Tradeoffs
concepts.l0: Diffusion enables parallel token generation but may trade off controllability and factuality.

concepts.title: Reasoning-centric Models
concepts.l0: Models designed for complex reasoning via RL and test-time compute scaling.
l1: e.g. OpenAI o1 framing, DeepSeek-R1 research line

concepts.title: RL-heavy Reasoning Models
concepts.l0: Pure-RL incentives for emergent reasoning patterns without heavy supervised traces.

concepts.title: Test-time Compute Scaling (TTS)
concepts.l0: Allocating more inference compute to improve answer quality on hard problems.

concepts.title: Best-of-N / Self-consistency
concepts.l0: Sample multiple completions and select the best via voting or a verifier.

concepts.title: Tree Search / MCTS over Reasoning
concepts.l0: Explore a tree of reasoning traces using Monte Carlo Tree Search.

concepts.title: Compute-optimal Allocation per Prompt
concepts.l0: Route easy prompts to cheap paths and hard prompts to expensive reasoning; frontier efficiency.

concepts.title: Latent Reasoning via Recurrence
concepts.l0: Frontier architecture concept: recurrent unrolling for reasoning in latent space.

concepts.title: Liquid Foundation Models (LFMs)
concepts.l0: On-device-first foundation models optimized for speed, memory-efficiency, and edge resilience.
l1: Cross-links to edge inference, privacy, adaptive systems

concepts.title: Pretraining & Data Curriculum
concepts.l0: Large-scale training on web data with carefully designed data mixtures.

concepts.title: Web-scale Pretraining
concepts.l0: Training on internet-scale text corpora (Common Crawl, etc.).

concepts.title: Domain-adaptive Pretraining (DAPT)
concepts.l0: Continue pretraining on domain-specific corpora to specialize a foundation model.

concepts.title: Continued Pretraining
concepts.l0: Extend pretraining on new data for specialization or knowledge updates.

concepts.title: Data Mixture Design
concepts.l0: Choosing proportions of code, math, multilingual, instruction, and other data types.

concepts.title: Deduplication, Filtering & Decontamination
concepts.l0: Remove duplicates, low-quality content, and benchmark data leakage from training sets.

concepts.title: Synthetic Data Generation
concepts.l0: Teacher→student pipelines where a stronger model generates training data for a weaker one.

concepts.title: Fine-tuning Methods
concepts.l0: Adapting a pretrained model to specific tasks or behaviors.

concepts.title: Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT)
concepts.l0: Train on curated (instruction, response) pairs to teach instruction-following.

concepts.title: Parameter-efficient Fine-tuning (PEFT)
concepts.l0: Update only a small subset of parameters to reduce compute and memory.

concepts.title: LoRA / QLoRA
concepts.l0: Low-Rank Adaptation: inject trainable low-rank matrices into frozen weights.
l1: QLoRA adds quantization for memory efficiency

concepts.title: Adapters / Prefix Tuning
concepts.l0: Insert small trainable modules or prepend learnable tokens to frozen models.

concepts.title: Distillation
concepts.l0: Transfer knowledge from a larger teacher to a smaller student model.

concepts.title: Logit Distillation
concepts.l0: Student matches teacher's output probability distribution.

concepts.title: Preference Distillation
concepts.l0: Distill preference rankings from a teacher judge into a student.

concepts.title: Reasoning Trace Distillation
concepts.l0: Distill chain-of-thought traces; risk of overfitting to style rather than capability.

concepts.title: Reinforcement Learning from Feedback (RLFT)
concepts.l0: Umbrella for preference-based training: RLHF, DPO, RLAIF, Constitutional AI.
l1: Alternatives trade off simplicity vs flexibility

concepts.title: RLHF
concepts.l0: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback; the canonical alignment pipeline.
l1: Train reward model from human comparisons
Optimize policy with PPO against reward model

concepts.title: Direct Preference Optimization (DPO)
concepts.l0: Simpler alternative to RLHF: optimize preferences directly without a separate reward model.

concepts.title: RLAIF (AI Feedback)
concepts.l0: Use AI-generated feedback instead of human feedback for reinforcement learning.

concepts.title: Constitutional AI
concepts.l0: Harmlessness from AI feedback guided by explicit principles; self-improvement loop.

concepts.title: Process Supervision / PRMs
concepts.l0: Reward each reasoning step (not just final answer); more reliable for reasoning tasks.

concepts.title: Alignment Targets
concepts.l0: What the model is aligned to: helpfulness, safety, policy, style, tool correctness.

concepts.title: Helpfulness, Harmlessness, Honesty
concepts.l0: The classic HHH alignment triple from Anthropic's framing.

concepts.title: Policy Compliance / Instruction Hierarchy
concepts.l0: Following system-level policies even when user instructions conflict.

concepts.title: Style / Brand Voice
concepts.l0: Aligning model outputs to a specific tone, personality, or brand guidelines.

concepts.title: Domain Constraints
concepts.l0: Medical, legal, financial, or other domain-specific behavioral guidelines.

concepts.title: Tool-usage Correctness
concepts.l0: Ensuring the model calls APIs/tools with correct arguments and follows contracts.

concepts.title: Deliberative Alignment
concepts.l0: Model explicitly reasons about safety policies before responding (as in o1 system card).

concepts.title: Safety Training & Robustness
concepts.l0: Training techniques to make models resistant to adversarial attacks and misuse.

concepts.title: Adversarial Training
concepts.l0: Train on jailbreak variants and adversarial inputs to improve robustness.

concepts.title: Refusal Training & Safe Completion
concepts.l0: Train the model to refuse harmful requests while remaining helpful.

concepts.title: Prompt Injection Robustness Training
concepts.l0: Training to resist prompt injection; limited guarantees but still important.

concepts.title: Data Poisoning Defenses
concepts.l0: Filters and provenance checks to detect and prevent training data poisoning.

concepts.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
concepts.l0: Augment generation with retrieved context (documents, chunks, or structured knowledge) to improve grounding.
l1: Citations and quote windows help grounding

concepts.title: RAG Indexing
concepts.l0: Preparing documents for retrieval: chunking, embedding, metadata enrichment.

concepts.title: Chunking Strategies
concepts.l0: Fixed-size, semantic, or structure-aware splitting of documents into retrievable units.

concepts.title: Metadata Enrichment
concepts.l0: Adding source, timestamps, ACLs, entity tags to chunks for filtered retrieval.

concepts.title: RAG Retrieval
concepts.l0: Finding relevant chunks: dense vectors, sparse matching, hybrid approaches.

concepts.title: Dense Vector Retrieval
concepts.l0: Embed queries and documents into a shared vector space; retrieve by similarity.

concepts.title: Sparse (BM25) & Hybrid Retrieval
concepts.l0: Combine keyword-based (BM25) and dense retrieval for better coverage.

concepts.title: Reranking
concepts.l0: Re-score initial retrieval results with cross-encoders or LLM judges for higher precision.

concepts.title: RAG Generation & Attribution
concepts.l0: Prompt augmentation with citations, quote windows, and grounding strategies.

concepts.title: Naive RAG
concepts.l0: Single retrieve → generate; simplest RAG pattern.

concepts.title: Multi-stage RAG
concepts.l0: Query rewrite → retrieve → rerank → generate; with optional decomposition for multi-hop.

concepts.title: Adaptive / Selective RAG
concepts.l0: Retrieve only when needed; a router decides whether retrieval would help.

concepts.title: Agentic RAG
concepts.l0: Retrieval as a tool used iteratively during agent planning and execution.

concepts.title: Multi-index RAG
concepts.l0: Query multiple corpora with different retrieval policies and merge results.

concepts.title: Multimodal RAG
concepts.l0: Retrieve and integrate image, video, audio content alongside text.

concepts.title: GraphRAG
concepts.l0: A RAG approach that builds/uses a graph over a corpus (entities/relations/communities) to improve multi-hop QA.
l1: Graph traversal + text retrieval can complement each other

concepts.title: Self-RAG
concepts.l0: Retrieve/generate/critique with self-reflection tokens for adaptive retrieval decisions.

concepts.title: RAG-Fusion
concepts.l0: Generate multiple query variants and merge results via reciprocal rank fusion.

concepts.title: Rewrite-Retrieve-Read
concepts.l0: Rewrite the user query before retrieval to improve relevance.

concepts.title: Self-routing RAG
concepts.l0: Selective retrieval + knowledge verbalization via router logic.

concepts.title: Knowledge Graphs
concepts.l0: Structured representations of entities and relations for multi-hop reasoning.

concepts.title: Entity Extraction
concepts.l0: Identify and extract entities from text for graph construction.

concepts.title: Relation Extraction
concepts.l0: Identify relationships between entities from text.

concepts.title: Entity Resolution
concepts.l0: Canonicalize and merge mentions that refer to the same entity/concept.

concepts.title: Ontology Alignment
concepts.l0: Map entities/relations between different ontologies or knowledge bases.

concepts.title: Graph Traversal for Multi-hop QA
concepts.l0: Walk the graph to answer questions requiring multiple reasoning steps.

concepts.title: Graph Embeddings
concepts.l0: Node2vec, GNNs, text+graph hybrid embeddings for graph-based retrieval.

concepts.title: Query Planning over Graph + Text
concepts.l0: Combine graph traversal with text retrieval for complex questions.

concepts.title: Graph Grounding & Citation
concepts.l0: Cite graph facts + source text spans for verifiable answers.

concepts.title: Memory Architectures
concepts.l0: Application-level memory for LLM systems (not just KV cache).

concepts.title: Short-term / Working Memory
concepts.l0: Conversation window management and summarization buffers.

concepts.title: Long-term Memory
concepts.l0: Persistent vector memory (episodic), structured facts/preferences, knowledge graph memory.

concepts.title: Task Memory
concepts.l0: Plans, intermediate artifacts, and tool outputs retained during task execution.

concepts.title: Personalization Memory
concepts.l0: User preferences stored with consent and policy controls.

concepts.title: Memory Governance
concepts.l0: Retention policies, right to be forgotten, privacy boundaries, redaction.

concepts.title: Agent Architectures
concepts.l0: Conceptual patterns for how agents reason, plan, and act.

concepts.title: Reactive Agents
concepts.l0: Single-step tool calls without planning; simplest agent pattern.

concepts.title: Plan-and-Execute Agents
concepts.l0: Create a plan first, then execute steps sequentially.

concepts.title: ReAct-style Agents
concepts.l0: Interleave thought + action + observation in a loop.

concepts.title: Reflection / Critique Loops
concepts.l0: Agent reviews its own outputs and iterates for improvement.

concepts.title: Multi-agent Systems
concepts.l0: Multiple specialist agents coordinated by an orchestrator.
l1: Introduces new attack surfaces for agent-to-agent spoofing

concepts.title: Tool-augmented Reasoning
concepts.l0: Code interpreter, DB query, web search, etc. as reasoning tools.

concepts.title: Sandboxed Execution
concepts.l0: Run agent tool calls in isolated sandboxes for security.

concepts.title: Tooling Primitives
concepts.l0: Core building blocks for tool use: function calling, routing, validation.

concepts.title: Function Calling / Structured Invocation
concepts.l0: Model outputs structured tool calls with name and arguments.

concepts.title: Tool Routers
concepts.l0: Decide whether to call a tool or answer directly.

concepts.title: Tool Result Validation
concepts.l0: Validate tool outputs against schemas and type checks.

concepts.title: Idempotency & Retries
concepts.l0: Ensure tool calls can be safely retried without side effects.

concepts.title: Side-effect Controls
concepts.l0: Approve/deny gates for tool calls that modify external state.

concepts.title: Interoperability Protocols
concepts.l0: Standards for connecting LLM apps to tools, data, and other agents.

concepts.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
concepts.l0: A protocol for connecting LLM applications to external tools and data sources.
l1: Schemas + validation help prevent unsafe tool use

concepts.title: Agent2Agent (A2A)
concepts.l0: A protocol for agent-to-agent interoperability and coordination.
l1: Adds a new attack surface for spoofing and injection

concepts.title: LangChain Agent Protocol
concepts.l0: Framework-agnostic APIs for serving agents in production.

concepts.title: Activity Protocol (Microsoft Agents SDK)
concepts.l0: Standardizes activity messages between agents, users, and channels.

concepts.title: W3C ActivityPub / ActivityStreams 2.0
concepts.l0: Federated publish/subscribe for agent actions; enables 'agentic web' concepts.

concepts.title: Agent Safety & Controls
concepts.l0: Security controls specific to agentic systems.

concepts.title: Tool Permissioning (Capability-based)
concepts.l0: Capability-based access control for tool invocation.

concepts.title: Human Approval for Side Effects
concepts.l0: Require human confirmation before executing state-changing tool calls.

concepts.title: Output Constraints (Schemas)
concepts.l0: Force structured outputs to prevent arbitrary code/text injection.

concepts.title: Prompt Firewalling / Instruction Hierarchy
concepts.l0: Separate system/user/tool instructions with enforced priority levels.

concepts.title: Tool Input Sanitization
concepts.l0: Sanitize retrieved text before passing to tools to prevent injection.

concepts.title: Evaluation Types
concepts.l0: Offline, online, and dimension-specific evaluation of LLM systems.

concepts.title: Offline Evals
concepts.l0: Pre-deployment evaluation on curated and synthetic test sets.

concepts.title: Golden Sets
concepts.l0: Curated human-labeled test cases for regression and quality measurement.

concepts.title: Synthetic Test Generation
concepts.l0: Auto-generate test cases with LLMs + human review for coverage.

concepts.title: Regression Tests
concepts.l0: Prompt + expected property assertions to catch quality regressions.

concepts.title: Online Evals
concepts.l0: In-production evaluation via experiments and user feedback.

concepts.title: A/B Tests for Prompts/Models
concepts.l0: Compare prompt or model variants in production with real users.

concepts.title: Canary & Gradual Rollout
concepts.l0: Deploy changes to a small percentage of traffic first, then expand.

concepts.title: Human Feedback Loops
concepts.l0: Thumbs up/down, issue tags, and other inline user feedback.

concepts.title: Eval Dimensions
concepts.l0: What to measure: quality, safety, security, reliability, latency, grounding.

concepts.title: Quality: Helpfulness & Correctness
concepts.l0: Does the output actually help the user and contain correct information?

concepts.title: Safety: Policy Compliance
concepts.l0: Does the output comply with content policies and avoid harm?

concepts.title: Security: Injection Resistance
concepts.l0: Can the system resist prompt injection and data exfiltration attempts?

concepts.title: Reliability: Tool Success Rate
concepts.l0: Tool call success rates, retry rates, and overall system reliability.

concepts.title: Latency & Cost
concepts.l0: Tokens consumed, time-to-first-token, end-to-end latency, cost per query.

concepts.title: Grounding: Citation Precision/Recall
concepts.l0: Are citations accurate and do they cover all claims?

concepts.title: Evals for Agents
concepts.l0: Agent-specific evaluation challenges: tool use, planning, side effects, memory.

concepts.title: Tool-use Correctness Eval
concepts.l0: Did the agent call the right tool with correct arguments?

concepts.title: Planning Stability Eval
concepts.l0: Does the agent avoid loops, dead ends, and unnecessary retries?

concepts.title: Side-effect Safety Checks
concepts.l0: Did the agent avoid unintended mutations or dangerous actions?

concepts.title: Stateful Memory Correctness
concepts.l0: Does the agent correctly maintain and use stateful memory across turns?

concepts.title: Observability & Instrumentation
concepts.l0: Tracing, metrics, and events for LLM systems.

concepts.title: OpenTelemetry GenAI Semantic Conventions
concepts.l0: Tracing/metrics conventions for GenAI systems (prompts, responses, tool calls, retrieval, and agent steps).
l1: Instrument prompt, tool, and retrieval traces carefully to avoid PII leakage

concepts.title: Prompt + Response Metadata
concepts.l0: Log prompt templates, response content (with PII care), and metadata.

concepts.title: Token Counts & Model Info
concepts.l0: Track token usage, model name/version for cost and performance analysis.

concepts.title: Tool Call Traces
concepts.l0: Trace each tool invocation with arguments, latency, and results.

concepts.title: Retrieval Traces
concepts.l0: Log queries, retrieved doc IDs, ranks, and relevance scores.

concepts.title: Safety Filter Actions
concepts.l0: Record when safety filters trigger: what was blocked and why.

concepts.title: Caching Hits/Misses
concepts.l0: Track prompt cache and KV cache utilization.

concepts.title: LLMOps Stack
concepts.l0: Tool-agnostic components of an LLM operations platform.

concepts.title: Tracing Backend
concepts.l0: Backend for storing and querying distributed traces (e.g., Jaeger, Tempo).

concepts.title: Eval Harness
concepts.l0: Framework for running evaluation suites and tracking results over time.

concepts.title: Prompt Registry
concepts.l0: Version-controlled store for prompt templates and system prompts.

concepts.title: Model Registry
concepts.l0: Track model versions, metadata, and deployment status.

concepts.title: Dataset / Version Store
concepts.l0: Versioned storage for training, eval, and test datasets.

concepts.title: Policy / Guardrail Config
concepts.l0: Configuration store for safety policies and guardrail rules.

concepts.title: Inference Optimization
concepts.l0: Techniques to make LLM inference faster and more memory-efficient.

concepts.title: KV Cache
concepts.l0: Key/value tensors cached during autoregressive decoding to avoid recomputing attention.
l1: Stores keys and values per layer

concepts.title: Continuous / Dynamic Batching
concepts.l0: Add new requests to a running batch without waiting for all to finish.

concepts.title: Speculative Decoding
concepts.l0: Use a small draft model to propose tokens; verify in parallel with the large model.

concepts.title: Prefix / Prompt Caching
concepts.l0: Cache KV states for common prompt prefixes to avoid redundant computation.

concepts.title: Quantization
concepts.l0: Reduce precision of weights and/or KV cache to lower memory and compute requirements.

concepts.title: Compilation / Kernel Fusion
concepts.l0: Compile model graphs and fuse operations for hardware-specific optimization.

concepts.title: FlashAttention
concepts.l0: An IO-aware exact attention kernel that improves attention throughput by reducing memory reads/writes.

concepts.title: PagedAttention
concepts.l0: Paging-inspired memory management for KV cache that reduces fragmentation and waste.

concepts.title: vLLM
concepts.l0: An LLM serving system focused on high-throughput inference; popularized PagedAttention for KV cache management.
l1: KV cache paging reduces fragmentation and waste

concepts.title: Parallelism & Distributed Serving
concepts.l0: Strategies for distributing model inference across multiple devices.

concepts.title: Tensor Parallelism
concepts.l0: Split individual layers across devices for intra-layer parallelism.

concepts.title: Pipeline Parallelism
concepts.l0: Split model layers across devices for inter-layer parallelism.

concepts.title: Expert Parallelism
concepts.l0: Distribute MoE experts across devices; requires careful load balancing.

concepts.title: Data Parallel Inference
concepts.l0: Run model replicas on different devices for throughput scaling.

concepts.title: High-speed Interconnect (NCCL, InfiniBand)
concepts.l0: Low-latency networking crucial for distributed inference performance.

concepts.title: Hardware Concepts
concepts.l0: Compute hardware architectures and constraints for AI inference.

concepts.title: GPU / TPU / NPU Architectures
concepts.l0: Accelerator architectures optimized for matrix operations and AI workloads.

concepts.title: Memory Hierarchy (HBM, SRAM, Cache)
concepts.l0: Memory tiers determine data movement costs; critical for attention kernel design.

concepts.title: Bandwidth vs FLOPs Bottlenecks
concepts.l0: Most LLM inference is memory-bandwidth-bound, not compute-bound.

concepts.title: Multi-node Networking
concepts.l0: InfiniBand and high-speed Ethernet for multi-node training and inference.

concepts.title: Edge Hardware Constraints
concepts.l0: Battery, thermal, and memory limits for on-device AI.

concepts.title: Deployment Modes
concepts.l0: Where and how models are served in production.

concepts.title: Cloud Serving
concepts.l0: Serve models in cloud data centers for scalability and cost efficiency.

concepts.title: On-premises Serving
concepts.l0: Serve models on owned infrastructure for data sovereignty and compliance.

concepts.title: Edge / On-device Serving
concepts.l0: Run models directly on user devices for privacy and low latency.

concepts.title: Hybrid Deployment
concepts.l0: Split compute between cloud and edge; local retrieval with cloud inference.

concepts.title: OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications
concepts.l0: A practical taxonomy of common LLM application risks (prompt injection, insecure output handling, data poisoning, etc.).

concepts.title: Direct Prompt Injection
concepts.l0: Attacker directly crafts input to override system instructions.

concepts.title: Indirect Prompt Injection
concepts.l0: Untrusted retrieved content (docs/web) contains instructions that the model mistakenly follows.
l1: Often targets agentic RAG and tool use
Can lead to data exfiltration or unsafe side effects

concepts.title: Data Exfiltration
concepts.l0: Extracting sensitive data via tool calls, retrieval manipulation, or memory access.

concepts.title: Tool Abuse
concepts.l0: Manipulating the model into making unapproved or harmful tool calls.

concepts.title: Model Extraction / Distillation Attacks
concepts.l0: Stealing model weights or capabilities through systematic querying; also a policy/legal concern.

concepts.title: Training Data Poisoning
concepts.l0: Injecting malicious data into training sets to create backdoors or degrade quality.

concepts.title: Supply Chain Vulnerabilities
concepts.l0: Compromised models, dependencies, MCP servers, or plugins in the deployment pipeline.

concepts.title: Sensitive Info Disclosure
concepts.l0: PII, secrets, or internal data leaked in model outputs or logs.

concepts.title: Jailbreaks / Policy Evasion
concepts.l0: Techniques to bypass safety training and content policies.

concepts.title: Denial of Wallet
concepts.l0: Cost amplification attacks that drain API budgets via expensive queries.

concepts.title: Multi-agent Attack Surfaces
concepts.l0: Agent-to-agent spoofing, message injection, and coordination manipulation.

concepts.title: Retrieval Sanitization
concepts.l0: Mitigations that reduce instruction-following from retrieved content (e.g. strip instructions, separate data/instructions).

concepts.title: Tool Allowlist
concepts.l0: Deny-by-default tool access: only permit explicitly approved tools and scoped operations.

concepts.title: Least Privilege
concepts.l0: Grant the minimum capabilities needed for a tool invocation (scoped tokens, short lifetimes, limited resources).

concepts.title: Sandboxed Execution
concepts.l0: Run code, shell commands, and file operations in isolated containers.

concepts.title: Structured Outputs + Strict Parsing
concepts.l0: JSON schema validation on model outputs to prevent arbitrary content injection.

concepts.title: Input/Output Filtering
concepts.l0: Policy-based and PII filtering on inputs and outputs.

concepts.title: Rate Limits, Cost Guards, Timeouts
concepts.l0: Prevent abuse and cost overruns via rate limiting and budget controls.

concepts.title: Provenance & Signing
concepts.l0: Cryptographic signing and provenance tracking for tool servers and model artifacts.

concepts.title: Monitoring + Alerting
concepts.l0: Real-time detection of anomalous patterns, policy violations, and attacks.

concepts.title: Red Teaming
concepts.l0: Structured adversarial testing of AI systems to find vulnerabilities and failure modes.

concepts.title: Red Teaming Methodology & Playbooks
concepts.l0: Government and industry playbooks for structured AI red teaming exercises.

concepts.title: Offensive Security Capability Eval
concepts.l0: Evaluate models' ability to assist with vulnerability research and exploitation.

concepts.title: Project Naptime
concepts.l0: LLM-assisted vulnerability research; frontier node for offensive AI capabilities.

concepts.title: Risk Management Frameworks
concepts.l0: Structured approaches to identifying and managing AI risks.

concepts.title: NIST AI RMF 1.0
concepts.l0: A risk management framework for AI systems: govern, map, measure, manage.

concepts.title: ISO/IEC 42001:2023
concepts.l0: International standard for AI management systems; certifiable framework.

concepts.title: Regulation
concepts.l0: Legal and regulatory requirements for AI systems.

concepts.title: EU AI Act
concepts.l0: EU regulation classifying AI systems by risk level with obligations for high-risk and GPAI.
l1: Requires conformity assessments for high-risk AI

concepts.title: Responsible AI Principles
concepts.l0: Organization-level ethical guidelines and policy frameworks for AI.

concepts.title: Microsoft Responsible AI Standard
concepts.l0: Microsoft's principles + Responsible AI Standard as policy/process anchors.

concepts.title: Google AI Principles / SAIF
concepts.l0: Google's AI principles and Secure AI Framework (SAIF) for responsible deployment.

concepts.title: Governance Artifacts
concepts.l0: Documents and processes that operationalize AI governance.

concepts.title: Model Cards / System Cards
concepts.l0: Structured documentation of model capabilities, limitations, and intended uses.

concepts.title: Datasheets for Datasets
concepts.l0: Documentation of dataset provenance, composition, and intended uses.

concepts.title: Risk Assessments (DPIA-like)
concepts.l0: Systematic evaluation of AI system risks and impacts.

concepts.title: Incident Response Runbooks
concepts.l0: Procedures for handling AI system failures and security incidents.

concepts.title: Human Oversight Procedures
concepts.l0: Processes ensuring meaningful human review of AI decisions.

concepts.title: Audit Logs & Trace Retention
concepts.l0: Policies for retaining traces, decisions, and actions for accountability.

concepts.title: Access Control Policies
concepts.l0: Policies governing who can access memory, retrieval data, and model outputs.

concepts.title: Third-party Vendor Risk Reviews
concepts.l0: Assessment processes for AI vendors, model providers, and tool integrations.

concepts.title: Human-AI Interaction Foundations
concepts.l0: Research-grounded guidelines for designing effective human-AI experiences.

concepts.title: Guidelines for Human-AI Interaction (18 Guidelines)
concepts.l0: Microsoft's 18 guidelines for human-AI interaction; canonical UX anchor.

concepts.title: Google PAIR People + AI Guidebook
concepts.l0: Practical product/UX guidebook for designing AI-powered applications.

concepts.title: AI UX Concepts
concepts.l0: Key UX dimensions for AI products: trust, transparency, control, feedback.

concepts.title: Trust Calibration
concepts.l0: Help users develop appropriate trust levels—avoid both overtrust and undertrust.

concepts.title: Transparency & Explainability
concepts.l0: Communicate what the AI does, why, and what its limits are.

concepts.title: Uncertainty Communication
concepts.l0: Show confidence levels, citations, and caveats to support informed decisions.

concepts.title: Error Recovery
concepts.l0: Undo, regenerate, refine—give users tools to recover from AI mistakes.

concepts.title: User Control
concepts.l0: Editable drafts, sliders, constraints—let users shape AI behavior.

concepts.title: Feedback Capture
concepts.l0: Inline ratings, reason codes, and other mechanisms for collecting user feedback.

concepts.title: Safety UX
concepts.l0: Refusals that are helpful, offer safe alternatives, and explain why.

concepts.title: Privacy UX
concepts.l0: Memory controls, data usage disclosures, and consent management.

concepts.title: AI UI Patterns
concepts.l0: High-leverage UI patterns for AI-powered applications.

concepts.title: Chat UI
concepts.l0: Conversational interface; the default GenAI interaction pattern.

concepts.title: Copilot UI
concepts.l0: Inline suggestions in the user's working context (IDE, editor, etc.).

concepts.title: Canvas UI
concepts.l0: Co-editing interface for structured artifacts (documents, diagrams).

concepts.title: Agent UI
concepts.l0: Task list + execution trace + approval gates for autonomous agents.

concepts.title: Plan / Act / Review UI
concepts.l0: Explicit stages: show the plan, execute, then review results.

concepts.title: Retrieval UI
concepts.l0: Citations, source viewer, quote highlighting for RAG applications.

concepts.title: Tool Execution UI
concepts.l0: Dry-run preview, diffs, and confirmations for tool-using agents.

concepts.title: Memory UI
concepts.l0: View, edit, and delete what the AI remembers about the user.

concepts.title: AI Product Design Patterns
concepts.l0: System-level patterns for building reliable AI products.

concepts.title: Human-in-the-loop Approval
concepts.l0: Require human approval gates for side effects and high-stakes decisions.

concepts.title: Policy-first Requirements
concepts.l0: Define safety acceptance criteria before building features.

concepts.title: Eval-driven Development
concepts.l0: Block shipping on eval thresholds; CI/CD gates on quality metrics.

concepts.title: Fallback & Degrade Gracefully
concepts.l0: Fall back to smaller model, retrieval-only, or safe refusal when primary path fails.

concepts.title: Multi-model Routing
concepts.l0: Route easy tasks to cheap models and hard tasks to reasoning models.

concepts.title: Data Flywheel Integration
concepts.l0: Wire telemetry → evals → improvements into the product development cycle.

concepts.title: Data Flywheel
concepts.l0: Instrumentation → data → evaluation → improvements → better product → more usage → more data.
l1: Safety constraints: avoid reinforcing bias or collecting sensitive data

concepts.title: Adaptation Mechanisms
concepts.l0: Ways AI systems improve and personalize over time.

concepts.title: Personalization
concepts.l0: Adapt to users via explicit preferences and implicit behavioral signals.

concepts.title: Bandits / RL at Product Layer
concepts.l0: Use bandit algorithms or RL for ranking, suggestions, and content selection.

concepts.title: Continual Learning (Offline)
concepts.l0: Periodically retrain or update models on new data in controlled offline cycles.

concepts.title: Online Learning
concepts.l0: Update models in real-time from production data; rare in high-risk settings.

concepts.title: Prompt Adaptation
concepts.l0: Dynamically adjust system prompts based on context, with policy constraints.

concepts.title: Flywheel Failure Modes
concepts.l0: Ways data flywheels can go wrong and amplify harm.

concepts.title: Feedback Loops Amplifying Bias
concepts.l0: Self-reinforcing cycles that amplify existing biases in data and behavior.

concepts.title: Reward Hacking
concepts.l0: Optimizing proxy metrics while degrading actual user value.

concepts.title: Distribution Shift / Concept Drift
concepts.l0: Model performance degrades as real-world data distribution changes over time.

concepts.title: Data Poisoning via Feedback
concepts.l0: Adversaries inject harmful feedback to corrupt the flywheel.

concepts.title: LLM Ecosystem
concepts.l0: Vendors, model families, platforms, repositories, and licensing for the LLM landscape.

concepts.title: OpenAI
concepts.l0: Creator of GPT series, DALL-E, and ChatGPT.

concepts.title: Anthropic
concepts.l0: AI safety company; creator of the Claude model family.

concepts.title: Google DeepMind
concepts.l0: Merged AI lab behind Gemini, AlphaFold, and foundational research.

concepts.title: Meta AI
concepts.l0: Open-weights advocate; creator of the Llama model family.

concepts.title: Mistral AI
concepts.l0: European AI lab building open and commercial Mistral/Mixtral models.

concepts.title: Cohere
concepts.l0: Enterprise LLM provider; Command R family with RAG focus.

concepts.title: Microsoft
concepts.l0: Azure OpenAI host; Phi small-model research; major AI infra provider.

concepts.title: Alibaba Cloud (Qwen)
concepts.l0: Chinese cloud provider; Qwen open-weight model family.

concepts.title: Baidu (ERNIE)
concepts.l0: Chinese search company; ERNIE model family.

concepts.title: Tencent (Hunyuan)
concepts.l0: Chinese tech conglomerate; Hunyuan model family.

concepts.title: DeepSeek
concepts.l0: Chinese AI lab; DeepSeek-V3 series with strong open-weight performance.

concepts.title: xAI
concepts.l0: Elon Musk's AI company; creator of Grok models.

concepts.title: Aleph Alpha
concepts.l0: European AI company focused on sovereign, explainable LLMs.

concepts.title: Stability AI
concepts.l0: Open-source generative AI; Stable Diffusion, Stable LM.

concepts.title: Hugging Face
concepts.l0: AI community hub; Transformers library, Hub, Inference Endpoints.

concepts.title: Liquid AI
concepts.l0: MIT-spinoff building Liquid Foundation Models based on liquid time-constant networks.

concepts.title: GPT-4 Family
concepts.l0: OpenAI's GPT-4 series including GPT-4 Turbo and GPT-4.1.

concepts.title: GPT-4o Family
concepts.l0: OpenAI's omni-model family optimized for multimodal and speed.

concepts.title: OpenAI o-series (o1, o3)
concepts.l0: OpenAI's reasoning-focused model family using extended thinking.

concepts.title: Claude Family (Opus/Sonnet/Haiku)
concepts.l0: Anthropic's model family spanning capability tiers.

concepts.title: Gemini Family
concepts.l0: Google DeepMind's multimodal model family.

concepts.title: Llama 3 Family
concepts.l0: Meta's open-weight Llama 3 series.

concepts.title: Mistral / Mixtral Family
concepts.l0: Mistral AI's open and commercial models including MoE variants.

concepts.title: Command R Family
concepts.l0: Cohere's enterprise LLMs optimized for RAG and tool use.

concepts.title: Phi Family (Microsoft)
concepts.l0: Microsoft's small language models (SLMs) with strong performance per parameter.

concepts.title: Qwen3 Family
concepts.l0: Alibaba's open-weight multilingual model family.

concepts.title: ERNIE Family (Baidu)
concepts.l0: Baidu's knowledge-enhanced language models.

concepts.title: Hunyuan Family (Tencent)
concepts.l0: Tencent's large language and multimodal models.

concepts.title: DeepSeek-V3 Family
concepts.l0: DeepSeek's high-performance open-weight MoE models.

concepts.title: LFM Family (Liquid AI)
concepts.l0: Liquid AI's foundation models based on liquid time-constant architectures.

concepts.title: GPT-4o
concepts.l0: OpenAI's flagship omni model; multimodal input/output.

concepts.title: GPT-4.1
concepts.l0: OpenAI's coding-optimized GPT-4 variant.

concepts.title: o1
concepts.l0: OpenAI's first reasoning model with chain-of-thought at inference.

concepts.title: o3
concepts.l0: OpenAI's advanced reasoning model succeeding o1.

concepts.title: Claude Opus 4.6
concepts.l0: Anthropic's most capable model; excels at complex, agentic tasks.

concepts.title: Claude Sonnet 4.5
concepts.l0: Anthropic's balanced model; strong coding and reasoning.

concepts.title: Claude Haiku 4.5
concepts.l0: Anthropic's fastest and most cost-effective model.

concepts.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro
concepts.l0: Google's most capable Gemini model with extended thinking.

concepts.title: Llama 3.3 70B Instruct
concepts.l0: Meta's open-weight 70B instruction-tuned model.

concepts.title: Mistral Large 3
concepts.l0: Mistral's flagship commercial model.

concepts.title: Mixtral 8x22B
concepts.l0: Mistral's large MoE model; 8 experts with 22B params each.

concepts.title: Command R+
concepts.l0: Cohere's most capable RAG-optimized model.

concepts.title: Phi-4
concepts.l0: Microsoft's small but powerful reasoning model.

concepts.title: Qwen3
concepts.l0: Alibaba's latest multilingual model.

concepts.title: ERNIE 4.5
concepts.l0: Baidu's latest ERNIE large language model.

concepts.title: Hunyuan-Large
concepts.l0: Tencent's largest open-source MoE model.

concepts.title: DeepSeek-V3.2
concepts.l0: DeepSeek's latest high-performance open-weight MoE model.

concepts.title: Grok
concepts.l0: xAI's conversational model with real-time information access.

concepts.title: LFM-2
concepts.l0: Liquid AI's latest foundation model using liquid time-constant networks.

concepts.title: OpenAI API
concepts.l0: OpenAI's hosted API for GPT, DALL-E, and Whisper models.

concepts.title: Azure OpenAI Service
concepts.l0: Microsoft Azure-hosted OpenAI models with enterprise features.

concepts.title: Anthropic API
concepts.l0: Anthropic's hosted API for Claude models.

concepts.title: Google Vertex AI
concepts.l0: Google Cloud's ML platform hosting Gemini and open models.

concepts.title: Gemini API
concepts.l0: Google's direct API for Gemini models.

concepts.title: Hugging Face Inference Endpoints
concepts.l0: Managed inference for any Hugging Face Hub model.

concepts.title: Hugging Face TGI
concepts.l0: Open-source high-performance text generation server.

concepts.title: Together AI
concepts.l0: Cloud platform for running open-source models at scale.

concepts.title: Fireworks AI
concepts.l0: Fast inference platform specialized for open models.

concepts.title: Replicate
concepts.l0: Run ML models via API with simple deployment.

concepts.title: DeepSeek API
concepts.l0: DeepSeek's hosted API for their model family.

concepts.title: Hugging Face Transformers
concepts.l0: The most popular open-source library for transformer models; supports training and inference.

concepts.title: vLLM
concepts.l0: Open-source high-throughput LLM serving engine with PagedAttention.

concepts.title: llama.cpp
concepts.l0: C++ inference engine for running LLMs on CPU and consumer hardware.

concepts.title: Ollama
concepts.l0: Tool for running LLMs locally with simple CLI interface.

concepts.title: LangChain
concepts.l0: Framework for building LLM-powered applications with chains and agents.

concepts.title: LlamaIndex
concepts.l0: Data framework for connecting LLMs with external data sources (RAG).

concepts.title: Text Generation Inference (TGI)
concepts.l0: Hugging Face's production inference server for text generation.

concepts.title: Apache 2.0 License
concepts.l0: Permissive open-source license used by many AI frameworks and models.

concepts.title: MIT License
concepts.l0: Permissive open-source license; minimal restrictions.

concepts.title: Llama 3 Community License
concepts.l0: Meta's custom license for Llama 3 models; open with usage restrictions.

concepts.title: Proprietary API Terms
concepts.l0: Closed models available only through API access with usage terms.

concepts.title: Stability AI Community License
concepts.l0: Stability AI's license for open model weights with community terms.

concepts.title: Research Papers & Provenance
concepts.l0: Seminal research papers that introduced key concepts and methods.

concepts.title: Attention Is All You Need (2017)
concepts.l0: Introduced the Transformer architecture with self-attention.

concepts.title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers (2018)
concepts.l0: Introduced bidirectional masked language model pretraining.

concepts.title: T5: Text-to-Text Transfer Transformer (2019)
concepts.l0: Unified NLP tasks into a text-to-text framework.

concepts.title: Language Models are Unsupervised Multitask Learners (GPT-2, 2019)
concepts.l0: Showed large LMs can perform tasks zero-shot without fine-tuning.

concepts.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners (GPT-3, 2020)
concepts.l0: Demonstrated in-context few-shot learning at scale.

concepts.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG, 2020)
concepts.l0: Combined retrieval with generation for knowledge-grounded outputs.

concepts.title: REALM: Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training (2020)
concepts.l0: Pre-training with a learned retriever for knowledge-intensive tasks.

concepts.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models (Kaplan et al., 2020)
concepts.l0: Characterized power-law relationships between compute, data, and model size.

concepts.title: MMLU Benchmark (2020)
concepts.l0: Massive Multitask Language Understanding benchmark across 57 subjects.

concepts.title: Efficiently Modeling Long Sequences with Structured State Spaces (S4, 2021)
concepts.l0: Introduced structured state space models for long-range sequence modeling.

concepts.title: Switch Transformers (2021)
concepts.l0: Simplified MoE with one-expert routing for trillion-parameter models.

concepts.title: RoTary Position Embedding (RoPE, 2021)
concepts.l0: Rotation-based positional encoding enabling length extrapolation.

concepts.title: ALiBi: Train Short, Test Long (2021)
concepts.l0: Linear attention bias replacing positional embeddings.

concepts.title: Structured Denoising Diffusion in Discrete State-Spaces (D3PM, 2021)
concepts.l0: Extended diffusion models to discrete domains.

concepts.title: GLaM: Efficient Scaling with Mixture-of-Experts (2021)
concepts.l0: Demonstrated MoE scaling efficiency compared to dense models.

concepts.title: Training Compute-Optimal Large Language Models (Chinchilla, 2022)
concepts.l0: Showed optimal allocation of compute budget between model size and data.

concepts.title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting (2022)
concepts.l0: Eliciting step-by-step reasoning through prompting.

concepts.title: Self-Consistency Improves Chain of Thought Reasoning (2022)
concepts.l0: Sample multiple reasoning paths and take majority vote.

concepts.title: InstructGPT / Training with Human Feedback (2022)
concepts.l0: Pioneered RLHF for aligning LLMs to human instructions.

concepts.title: Constitutional AI (2022)
concepts.l0: Self-improvement through AI-generated critiques guided by principles.

concepts.title: FlashAttention: Fast and Memory-Efficient Attention (2022)
concepts.l0: IO-aware exact attention algorithm that reduces memory reads/writes.

concepts.title: Diffusion-LM (2022)
concepts.l0: Applied continuous diffusion to text generation.

concepts.title: Toolformer: Language Models Can Teach Themselves to Use Tools (2023)
concepts.l0: Taught LLMs to use external tools through self-supervised learning.

concepts.title: ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting (2023)
concepts.l0: Interleaved reasoning and action for grounded task solving.

concepts.title: Tree of Thoughts (2023)
concepts.l0: Tree-structured exploration of reasoning paths.

concepts.title: QLoRA: Efficient Finetuning of Quantized LLMs (2023)
concepts.l0: 4-bit quantized base model with LoRA adapters for efficient fine-tuning.

concepts.title: GPTQ: Post-Training Quantization (2023)
concepts.l0: One-shot weight quantization using approximate second-order information.

concepts.title: AWQ: Activation-aware Weight Quantization (2023)
concepts.l0: Quantization that preserves salient weights identified by activation patterns.

concepts.title: Efficient Memory Management for LLM Serving with PagedAttention (vLLM, 2023)
concepts.l0: Introduced PagedAttention for efficient KV cache management.

concepts.title: Retentive Network (RetNet, 2023)
concepts.l0: Dual-form attention supporting both parallel training and recurrent inference.

concepts.title: Hyena Hierarchy (2023)
concepts.l0: Sub-quadratic attention replacement using long convolutions.

concepts.title: Mamba: Linear-Time Sequence Modeling with Selective State Spaces (2023)
concepts.l0: Selective state space model with linear-time inference.

concepts.title: Direct Preference Optimization (DPO, 2023)
concepts.l0: Simplified RLHF by directly optimizing policy from preferences.

concepts.title: MT-Bench / Judging LLM-as-a-Judge (2023)
concepts.l0: Multi-turn benchmark using LLM judges for evaluation.

concepts.title: RETRO: Retrieval-Enhanced Transformer (2022)
concepts.l0: Pre-training with chunked cross-attention over retrieved neighbors.

concepts.title: Atlas: Few-shot Learning with Retrieval Augmented LMs (2023)
concepts.l0: Jointly trained retriever and LM for few-shot learning.

concepts.title: Neural Machine Translation of Rare Words with Subword Units (BPE, 2016)
concepts.l0: Introduced Byte Pair Encoding for subword tokenization.

concepts.title: SentencePiece (2018)
concepts.l0: Language-independent subword tokenizer and detokenizer.

concepts.title: Chatbot Arena (2024)
concepts.l0: Crowdsourced LLM evaluation via pairwise human preferences.

concepts.title: HELM (Holistic Evaluation of Language Models)
concepts.l0: Stanford's holistic evaluation covering accuracy, robustness, fairness, and efficiency.

concepts.title: MT-Bench
concepts.l0: Multi-turn benchmark with LLM-as-a-judge for conversational quality.

concepts.title: Chatbot Arena (LMSYS)
concepts.l0: Crowdsourced blind pairwise comparison platform for LLM ranking.

concepts.title: MMLU
concepts.l0: Massive Multitask Language Understanding across 57 academic subjects.

concepts.title: Retention Networks (RetNet)
concepts.l0: Dual-form architecture: parallel training like transformers, recurrent inference for efficiency.

concepts.title: Long-convolution LMs (Hyena)
concepts.l0: Replace attention with learnable long convolutions for sub-quadratic sequence modeling.

concepts.title: RWKV
concepts.l0: Combines RNN efficiency with transformer-level parallelism for training.
l1: Supports both parallel and sequential modes

concepts.title: Perceiver / Latent Bottleneck Models
concepts.l0: Cross-attention to a fixed-size latent array enables handling arbitrary input sizes.
l1: Handles very long or multimodal inputs

concepts.title: Continual / Online LLMs
concepts.l0: Architectures designed for continuous learning without catastrophic forgetting.

sources.title: NIST AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF 1.0)
Mamba: Linear-Time Sequence Modeling with Selective State Spaces
Switch Transformers: Scaling to Trillion Parameter Models
Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI Feedback
InstructGPT / Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
Self-RAG: Learning to Retrieve, Generate, and Critique
RAG-Fusion: Multi-query RAG with Reciprocal Rank Fusion
ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models
LoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
Red-Teaming for Generative AI: Silver Bullet or Security Theater?
Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
RoFormer: Enhanced Transformer with Rotary Position Embedding

chunks.content: During autoregressive decoding, keys and values from previous tokens are cached per layer to avoid recomputing attention over the full prefix.

payload.title: Paged attention
payload.l0: A memory layout and scheduling strategy for attention/KV cache that can reduce memory overhead at inference time.
l1: Often discussed in the context of high-throughput serving

reviewItems.prompt: KV cache stores ___ and ___ tensors per layer during decoding.
Self-attention weights are proportional to Softmax( ___ ).
